intro: Echinopsilon divaricatus, commonly known as the variable echinops, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is native to parts of North America, particularly in the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and produces small, spiny fruits known as achenes. Its leaves are typically narrow and often have a hairy texture. Echinopsilon divaricatus is adapted to arid environments and thrives in well-drained soils.
